title: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel about the decline of the American Dream in the 1920s, centered on Jay Gatsby's love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: This Side of Paradise
description: The story of Amory Blaine, a young man growing up in post–World War I America, exploring love, philosophy, and self-discovery.

title: Tender is the Night
description: A tale of romance and psychological complexity, set in the French Riviera, focusing on the Divers, a glamorous couple with secrets.

title: The Beautiful and Damned
description: Chronicles the doomed marriage of Anthony Patch, a socialite and presumptive heir to a fortune, and his wife Gloria.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A deeply moving story set in the racially segregated South, seen through the eyes of young Scout Finch, daughter of lawyer Atticus.
A dystopian tale about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and control to dominate its citizens, centering on Winston Smith.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel that follows Elizabeth Bennet as she deals with issues of manners, upbringing, and morality in 19th-century England.

title: Moby-Dick
description: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts the great white whale, Moby Dick, in this epic tale of revenge and the sea.

title: Jane Eyre
description: Follows an orphaned girl’s journey from a harsh childhood to a position as governess and her romantic entanglement with Mr. Rochester.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A psychological drama about a young man named Raskolnikov who commits a crime and must deal with the moral consequences.
